lettertext.hand:
May it please yo
r
good L. having recom-
mended, as I was willed, the cause of
Coro-
nel Stuart
, to
e
General States
, they have
sent unto me a copie of
e Scottishe Ambassa-
do
rs
Proposition, and of their answear unto
it: also a copie of their letters to
e
Kinge
,
and to
e
Chancelo
r
of
Scotland
: Whiche I
have sent yow all together. Howbeit I doe
presume,
at
e Ambassado
r
himself, hath bin
w
t
yow, er this, and hath signified all by
worde of mouth. Whiche I also thought by
him, to have written to yo
r
L. but that he
was not resolved, to take his jorney for
England
, when he parted from
e
Hage
.
I am nowe assured by
e
Greffier
of
e states, that their answear to her
Ma
tie
is agreed upon, and written, and wanteth
nothing but deliverie: whiche, as he hath
understoode, shall be made unto me.
It was thought er this, that
e Deputies appoin-
ted for England, should have taken their
voiage. But
Silla
e Pensioner of
Amster-
dam
, whiche was one of
e two,
at was elected,
hath refused
e charge. Wherupon they are
to seeke, howe their turne may be served.
Count Maurice
is nowe at
Utrecht
to take possession of his gouvernment: and
from thens he intendeth to visit
Overyssel
.
Heere is every thing quiet, and for ought I
can perceave, there is nothing meant to be
exploited, but by way of surprise. For the

Count hath had a long practis in hand [in]
tzertogenbosch
, w
c
hee carieth very secr[etly]
and hath imparted it to none but in spe[cial]
confidence, There are in
e Towne
t
[.]
that have promised by a certain nighte
to open such a passage under grownd, by
undermining
e walles as there shalbee
an entraunce for sufficient troupes to surpr[ise]
e place, I may have many such secre[t]
occasions, that would require a Cypher, w
ch
I beseech yo
r
L. to send mee if yo
u
thinck
yt convenient. This day
e Deput y of
the Towne of
Geneva
, who hath sojourned
heere since his coming out of England is
departed towards
Hamboro
having [wholy]
receaved
e collection of
e Provinces
w
ch
amountes to no more but 1300
li
ster
Having nothing els of any moment I take
my humble leave. At
e Hage N
o
12. 90
